1. Here we go again. The trains have been delayed for the fourth time this week!
2. Last week Steven placed an advert in the lonely hearts column of the local newspaper and he now
has three dates this week!
3. I’ll have to consult with my other half to see if we can lend you the money or not.
4. I recently found out that my husband has been leading a double life; he has a mistress in Paris at
the weekends and lives with us in the week.
5. As a police officer I cannot take somebody’s word for it. I need to check the facts.
6. There are often stories about love-rats in the tabloid papers.
7. Look, you need to pull yourself together over this. We’ll get through somehow.
8. I know that Cara is really excited about this business venture, but I told her not to count her
chickens before they hatch; she should be a bit cautious.
9. Have you read the statement from the defendant? I can’t understand a word of it!
10. Do you really think I’d go on holiday with Kat and George? You must be joking|kidding!
